application.description: Pix is an online platform open to all (pupils, students, anyone working or in professional training, seniors) designed to assess, develop and certify digital skills

texts.legal-informations:
With or without a Pix account, information relating to your progress in the customized test will be transmitted to us.'
'This information is used by Pix to improve our service.
texts.title: Start the course:

errors.existing-participation: You cannot take this customised test.

assessment.announcement: Sign up or log in to the Pix platform and start your test.

certify.description: Depending on your situation and under certain conditions, you will be able to take the Pix Certification exam. It is recognized in the professional world and allows you to highlight your digital skills. For more information, ask the organizer of this customised test.
certify.title: Your answers to this customised test will build your personal digital skills profile on Pix.

assessment.details: During this customised test, you will be able to:

develop.description: Every 5 questions, you will be able to see the right answers and receive advice as well as a personalized recommendation of tutorials to help you improve your skills.
develop.title: See your results as you go along and view tips to improve.

evaluate.description: You will have to carry out searches online, use your digital working environment, test your knowledge, etc.
evaluate.title: Measure your digital skills with fun and educational challenges that adapt to your level of proficiency  (through an adaptive algorithm).

assessment.legal: By clicking on “Begin“, information about your progress will be shared with the organiser so they can assist you if necessary. At the end of your customised test, your results will be shared with your organisation when clicking on “Submit my results“.
assessment.title: Begin your customised test

profiles-collection.announcement: Sign up or log in to the Pix platform and send your profile to the recipient organisation.
profiles-collection.legal: Information about your progress will be sent to the organiser so they can help you if necessary. It will only be sent with your permission.
profiles-collection.title: Submit your profile

campaign-landing.title: Presentation
campaign-landing.warning-message: If you are not { firstName } { lastName },

card.text-disabled:
This customised test has been deactivated by your organisation.'
'It is no longer possible to submit your results.

competences.information: Your certified score was calculated based on the answers you gave whilst taking the certification. It may be different from the score shown on your profile. When you took the certification, it was possible to reach a maximum of level {maxReachableLevelOnCertificationDate} in each competence and {maxReachablePixCountOnCertificationDate} pix.
competences.subtitle: (levels out of {maxReachableLevel})
competences.title: Certified competences

certificate.jury-info: Notes from the examining body are not displayed on the verification page of your certificate.
certificate.professionalizing-warning: The Pix certificate is recognised as professionalising by France Compétences upon reaching a minimum score of 120 pix.
certificate.title: Pix Certificate

verification-code.title: Verification code
verification-code.tooltip: Communicate this code to allow a third party to verify the authenticity of your certificate

candidate.disconnect-tip: If this is not your computer, please remember to log out.
candidate.ended-by-supervisor: Your invigilator has marked your certification test as completed. You cannot continue to answer questions.
candidate.ended-due-to-finalization: Your certification centre has ended the session. You can no longer answer questions.
candidate.remote-certification: If you're taking your Pix certificate remotely, please make sure you log out from the monitoring tool once your test is finished.
candidate.title: Your test is finished!

results.disclaimer: Your results, pending validation by the Pix team, will soon be available on your Pix account
results.step-1: Once logged in to your Pix account, you will be able to view your results in your profile under "My certifications" (accessible by clicking on your first name in the top right corner of the screen).
results.step-2: You will be able to download and share your certificate of achievement or provide the verification code to be used on the Pix website.
results.title: How can I view and share my certification results?

last-page.aria-label: Continue to the certification starting page

paragraphs.1: Pix Certification is an ''adaptive test'' designed to assess your level in ''all 16 digital skills'' in the Pix reference framework.
paragraphs.2: The ''difficulty of the questions adapts in real time'' according to the answers you give.
paragraphs.3: If some questions seem difficult, it's because the certification test aims to measure your maximum level. ''If you don't know how to answer a question, you can “skip” that question'': it will not be proposed again during this certification and will not be validated.
paragraphs.4: To obtain a score as close as possible to your ability, ''you need to complete the test''.
If you answer ''less than 20 questions, we won't be able to give you a score''.

2.title: How is the certification exam conducted ?

1.text:
For the ''free mode'' questions, signaled by a green icon : you have the right to look for information on the web and to use the digital environment available.'
'However, ''some websites will not be accessible during the certification''.
1.title: The free mode:

2.text: For the ''focus mode questions'', signaled by a yellow icon: you won’t be allowed to leave the page nor to look for information.
2.title: The focus mode:

list.1: Go to the bottom of the page
list.2: Select “Report a problem with the question”
list.4: Call the invigilator who will intervene to help you

4.text: ''If you encounter a technical issue'' (for example, the picture can’t be viewed), follow these steps:
4.title: What to do in case of a problem?

5.checkbox-label: By ticking this box, I recognise that I have taken note of these rules and I agree to comply with them.

list.1: ''Communicate with someone else'', within the exam room or outside of it, by physical or electronic means.
list.2: ''Use a mobile phone or any other connected device'' (other than the computer used for the certification).
list.3: ''Have recourse to an artificial intelligence system'' or to a chatbot.
list.4: ''Peruse a self-help forum'' giving a direct answer to a question.
list.5: ''Mobilise any other mean that would directly give the answer to the question'', without having to do the work required by the instructions.
list.6: ''Use another browser'' other than the one you are using for your Pix Certification test.

5.pix-companion: Access to certain sites is prohibited during the certification test, thanks to an extension installed on the browser. Any proven fraud (attempt to bypass the extension or failure to comply with the behaviors listed above) may invalidate your certification.
5.text: During the certification, it is forbidden to:
5.title: Rules to observe

complementary-certification.eligible: You are also eligible for the following complementary { count, plural, =1 {certification} other {certifications} } :
complementary-certification.outdated:
Vous n'êtes plus éligible à la certification {complementaryCertificationName} suite à son évolution.
Recontactez votre établissement ou l’organisation vous ayant proposé le parcours afin de repasser une campagne et ainsi redevenir éligible. Votre progression a été conservée et vous n'aurez qu'à jouer les nouvelles épreuves, cela devrait être rapide.

link.text: How do I certify my digital skills?

congratulation-banner.message: Well done, {fullName}, your Pix profile can now be certified.

error-messages.session-not-accessible: The session you are trying to join is no longer available.
error-messages.wrong-account: The information entered matches a candidate enrolled in the session and already logged in with another account. Please check that you are logged into the account that started the exam.

fields-validation.session-number-error: The session ID must only contain numbers.

certification-not-certifiable.title: Your profile cannot be certified yet.

finished.description: Your results will be available in your account shortly.
finished.title: Well done, you’ve finished!
finished.warning-text: If you are not using your own computer, remember to log out.

certification-start.access-code: Access code sent by the invigilator

contact.info: In accordance with the French law governing computer technology and freedoms (“Informatique et Libertés”), you can exercise your right to access and rectify your data by emailing

cgu.info: By clicking on “Start my test”, I agree to my identifying data, certification number and the circumstances in which the test was taken, as reported by the invigilator, being sent to Pix. Pix will use this information during the board of examiners’ deliberation to produce and archive my results and create my certificate. If this certification was ordered by an organisation, I agree to Pix sharing my results with them.

actions.open-close: Report a problem regarding the challenge

feedback-panel.description: Pix wants to hear from you so we can improve our tests!*

detail-selection.aria-first: Select the category of the problem encountered
detail-selection.aria-secondary: Select an option to specify your problem
detail-selection.label: Select an option to specify your problem

options.answer-not-accepted: My answer is correct but has not been approved

edit-failure.label: I cannot edit the file
edit-failure.solution:
The file is probably open in “Read only” or “Protected mode”.'
'Click on “Activate editing” or “Edit document” in the banner at the top of the file if this is shown. '
'Otherwise save the file under another name and try opening file again from here.

lost.label: I cannot find the downloaded file
lost.solution: By default, files you download will be saved in your “Downloads” folder. It may also have been saved to the same location as your last download...

open-failure.label: I cannot open the file on a computer
open-failure.solution: To answer this question, you need to use the LibreOffice suite, which is available free-of-charge for PC and Mac. It contains Libre Office Writer (equivalent to Word) and Libre Office Calc (equivalent to Excel).''Download Libre Office''

download.other: I have another problem with the file

embed-displayed-on-desktop-with-problems.label: On a computer, the simulator is displayed but has a problem
embed-displayed-on-desktop-with-problems.solution:
We are doing our best to make the simulators work on all devices, all operating systems, and all browsers but you may be using a specific system.'
'You can stop your test and resume on a computer. Please specify your problem, as well as your browser and your operating system.

embed-displayed-on-mobile-devices-with-p.label: On a smartphone or a tablet, the simulator is displayed but has a problem
embed-displayed-on-mobile-devices-with-p.solution:
We are doing our best to make the simulators work on all devices, all operating systems, and all browsers but you may be using a specific system.'
'Please specify your problem, as well as your type of device (smartphone, tablet etc.), your browser and your operating system.

embed-not-displayed.label: I cannot see the simulator/app
embed-not-displayed.solution:
Your internet connection may not be strong enough.'
'Refresh the page by clicking on the refresh button'' next to the address bar. Wait a little while, the simulator might display. '

'If it doesn’t, you can try again later or from another location with a better connection.

options.embed-other: There is another problem with the simulator/app
options.link-other: The link doesn’t work or has another problem

link-unauthorized.label: The link has been blocked by my organisation/school…
link-unauthorized.solution: You may belong to an organisation (schools, universities, companies, administrations, associations, etc.) that protects its users and devices by limiting the Internet pages you can access.

options.other-challenge-proposal: I have a (great) idea to suggest for a question
options.other-site-improvement: I have a suggestion for improving the platform

picture-not-displayed.label: The picture isn't displayed.
picture-not-displayed.solution:
Your internet connexion may be too slow.'
'Reload the page by clicking on the refresh button '' next to the address bar. Wait for a bit, the picture may be displayed. '

'If this isn't the case, please try again later or from somewhere with a better connection.

options.picture-other: There is another problem with the image.
options.question-improvement: I want to suggest an improvement to the question
options.question-not-understood: I do not understand the question
options.tutorial-link-error: The link to the tutorial is to another page or an error page
options.tutorial-not-accepted: The tutorial is not helpful to the question
options.tutorial-proposal: I have a tutorial to suggest

status.success:
'

'Your comment has been sent to the Pix project team.'

'Thank you!'

'

information.data-usage:
'

'Pix processes the data from this area to manage and analyse the difficulty encountered and benefit from your feedback. You have rights over your data which can be exercised via: dpo@pix.fr.'

'To find out more about protecting your data and your rights.'

'
information.guidance:
'

'*Make sure you write in this zone: for your benefit and the benefit of others, please stay objective and keep to the facts.'

'Do not enter any information about yourself or third parties, or any information related to health; religion; political, or philosophical opinions; trade union affiliation; ethnic origins; or penalties and convictions.'

'

modal.content:
'

'Do you confirm this problem report?'

'Thank you for this problem report, our team will review it soon. Every feedback helps us improve our services and the experience of all Pix users. Please note that we will not reach out to you on this topic. Thank you for your help.'

'
modal.title: Report confirmation

actions.no-send-feedback: No, I'm coming back to the test
actions.open-close: Report a problem with the question

feedback-panel-v3.description: Are you sure you want to report a problem?
feedback-panel-v3.information: By reporting a problem, your certification is paused while the invigilator intervenes to validate or invalidate your report

has-focused-out-of-window.certification: We have detected a page switch. Your answer will not be validated. If you have been forced to change pages, please inform your invigilator and answer the question in their presence.
has-focused-out-of-window.default: We have detected a page switch. During a certification test, your answer would not be validated.
has-focused-out-of-window.v3-accessible-certification: We have detected a page switch. If you have been forced to change pages in order to use a digital accessibility tool (such as a screen reader or virtual keyboard), please answer the question anyways.
has-focused-out-of-window.v3-certification: We have detected a page change. Your answer will be counted as wrong. If you have been forced to change page, tell your supervisor so that he or she can see this and report it, if necessary.

info-alert.adjusted-course-title: Answer this question without using the Internet or any applications.
info-alert.subtitle: If you switch pages or tabs during a certification test, you answer will not be validated.
info-alert.title: Answer this question without searching the internet or using any piece of software.

challenge.message: Notify your invigilator so that they can check your problem

companion.message: Notify your invigilator so that they can confirm the presence of the extension.

parts.feedback-v3: Report a problem with the question

skip-error-message.qcm: To validate, select at least two answers. Otherwise, click Skip.
skip-error-message.qcu: To validate, select an answer. Otherwise, click Skip.
skip-error-message.qroc: To validate, please fill in the text field. Otherwise, click Skip.
skip-error-message.qroc-auto-reply: You did not answer correctly. Try again or skip to the next question.
skip-error-message.qroc-positive-number: Please enter a number greater than or equal to 0, or skip the question.
skip-error-message.qrocm: To validate, please complete all answer fields. Otherwise, click Skip.

file-download.description: Pix lets you choose which format of file to download. If you do not know which option to use, select the default option. This is the file format that is the most commonly used.

sr-only.alternative-instruction: This question contains an illustration with a text alternative.

'You can also contact us via ''the help centre form''specifying the error code below in the description.'

'Please excuse any inconvenience caused.'

'The Pix team.'

'

modulix.beta-banner: This module is in beta version. You can send us your feedback at the end of this module to help us improve it.

details.explanationText1: The Pix training modules are comprised of lessons and activities to practice and develop your digital skills. The lessons take the form of videos, audios, images and texts. The activities allow you to practice and verify your answers directly. Each module takes around 10 minutes to complete on a particular subject with a level of difficulty from beginner to expert.
details.explanationText2: These training modules are actually in beta test phase. You can send us your suggestions for improvement in the questionnaire at the end of each module.

smallScreenModal.description: Some of the activities in this module may be difficult to perform on a small screen. For the best experience, we recommend that you use a computer.

If you do not know the answer to a question, 
you can probably find it on the internet.

If you see this picture, only use your own knowledge! 
Don’t search the internet or use your other equipments.
page1.title: ... with the exception of specific questions

page2.explanation:
Take all the time you need to finish your customised test. 
If a question is timed, we will let you know.
page2.title: There’s no time limit!

page3.explanation:
Access tutorials to learn more 
about each question and improve.

page4.explanation:
Based on your answers, 
Pix adapts the difficulty of the questions.
